result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew M Newman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $1,446.95 was PAID IN FULL.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Order for Early Dischare from Probation, signed and filed. Probation may discharge as of 12/07/16
Request for Early Discharge of Probation. Filed by Probation Agent Krajcir.
filed by Attorney Kay regarding Defendant testifying in municipal court

Defendant Mathew M Newman in court with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kay makes statements regarding sentencing.  Gary S. makes statements.  Andy S. makes statements.  Luann N. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____100 hours of community service

RESTITUTION:  $1,446.95 ( PAID IN FULL)

FINE:  $505.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered. Filed by Atty Kay in advance of 04/07/16 hearing.

Defendant Mathew M Newman in court with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kay requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint with the exception of Summit Elementary functions, pick up/drop off to allow for his daughter's attendance.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Defendant Mathew M Newman in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
